alston.minecraft

Class SlotArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.SlotArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public abstract class SlotArea
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Abstract representation of a sqauare area in the GUI that contains slots for Items and handles all interactions with them.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SlotArea(int columns, int rows, com.jme3.scene.Node node)
      Creates a new representation of a square are of GUI which contains slots for Items.

      Common operations called for place(); used instead of a super-call in the case that a SlotArea would no need this.
      Item[][] getItems() 
      com.jme3.scene.Node getNode() 
      abstract void place(Item item, int x, int y)
      Places the given Item in the given slot coordinates, whether or not it is currently occupied.
      void remove(int x, int y)
      Removes the Item at the specified coordinates from the inventory, removes all the refrences to it so it can be eligible for Garbage Collection, then replaces it with a new EmptyItem.
      void restore(com.jme3.scene.Node node)
      Restores the SlotArea's Items and transient fields.
      void setup()
      Instantiates Items in every index of items and adds the Item's Picture to the picturesNode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SlotArea

        public SlotArea(int columns,
        int rows,
        com.jme3.scene.Node node)
        Creates a new representation of a square are of GUI which contains slots for Items.
        Parameters:
        columns - Number of columns in the area of slots
        rows - Number of rows in the area of slots
        picturesNode - The Node that will contain all the Pictures
        numbersNode - The Node that will contain all the Numbers

    • Method Detail

      • place

        public abstract void place(Item item,
         int x,
         int y)
        Places the given Item in the given slot coordinates, whether or not it is currently occupied. This method should ensure that both fields and graphics are correctly changed.
        Parameters:
        item - The Item to be placed
        x - The x coordinates of the slot
        y - The y coordinates of the slot

      • defaultPlace

        public void defaultPlace(Item item,
                int x,
                int y)
        Common operations called for place(); used instead of a super-call in the case that a SlotArea would no need this.

      • setup

        public final void setup()
        Instantiates Items in every index of items and adds the Item's Picture to the picturesNode.

      • restore

        public void restore(com.jme3.scene.Node node)
        Restores the SlotArea's Items and transient fields.
        Parameters:
        picturesNode - The Node that the Pictures will be contained in

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

      • add

        public boolean add(Item item)
        Adds a given item to the slotArea. First searches for Items of same type to stack with. If none is found, searches for an empty inventory slot. If inventory is full, returns false
        Parameters:
        item - The Item to be added
        Returns:
        True if Item was added, false if it could not

      • remove

        public void remove(int x,
          int y)
        Removes the Item at the specified coordinates from the inventory, removes all the refrences to it so it can be eligible for Garbage Collection, then replaces it with a new EmptyItem.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the Item
        y - The y coordinate of the Item

      • getItems

        public Item[][] getItems()
        Returns:
        The Item contents of the slot area

        public com.jme3.scene.Node getNode()
